description: The WcmFreeMemory function is used to release memory resources allocated by the WCM functions.
return_value: This function does not return a value.
name: WcmFreeMemory

arguments.name: pMemory
arguments.description: Pointer to the memory to be freed.

description: The WcmGetProfileList function retrieves a list of profiles in preferred order, descending from the most preferred to the least preferred. The list includes all WCM-managed auto-connect profiles across all WCM-managed media types.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
name: WcmGetProfileList

arguments.name: *ppProfileList
arguments.description: Type: PWCM_PROFILE_INFO_LIST* The list of profiles.

description: The WcmQueryProperty function retrieves the value of a specified WCM property.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
remarks: The type of data stored in the ppData parameter will vary, depending on which property is being queried. This table shows the data type of each property.
name: WcmQueryProperty

arguments.name: *pInterface
arguments.description: Type: const GUID* The interface to query. For global properties, this parameter is NULL.

arguments.name: strProfileName
arguments.description: Type: LPCWSTR The name of the profile. If querying a non-global property (connection_cost, dataplan_status, or hotspot_profile), the profile must be specified or the call will fail.

arguments.name: Property
arguments.description: Type: WCM_PROPERTY The WCM property to query.

arguments.name: pdwDataSize
arguments.description: Type: PDWORD The size of the returned property value.

arguments.name: *ppData
arguments.description: Type: PBYTE* The returned property value.

description: The WcmSetProfileList function reorders a profile list or a subset of a profile list.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
name: WcmSetProfileList

arguments.name: *pProfileList
arguments.description: Type: WCM_PROFILE_INFO_LIST* The list of profiles to be reordered, provided in the preferred order (descending from the most preferred to the least preferred).

arguments.name: dwPosition
arguments.description: Type: DWORD Specifies the position in the list to start the reorder.

arguments.name: fIgnoreUnknownProfiles
arguments.description: Type: BOOL True if any profiles in pProfileList which do not exist should be ignored; the call will proceed with the remainder of the list. False if the call should fail without modifying the profile order if any profiles in pProfileList do not exist.

description: The WcmSetProperty function sets the value of a WCM property.
return_value: Type: DWORD Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or an error value otherwise.
remarks: The type of data stored in the pbData parameter will vary, depending on which property is being set. This table shows the data type of each property.
name: WcmSetProperty

arguments.name: *pInterface
arguments.description: Type: const GUID* The interface to set. For global properties, this parameter is NULL.

arguments.name: Property
arguments.description: Type: WCM_PROPERTY The WCM property to set.

arguments.name: dwDataSize
arguments.description: Type: DWORD The size of the new property value.

arguments.name: *pbData
arguments.description: Type: const BYTE* The new property value.
